intro: Nycteranthus inaequalis, commonly known as the night-flowering morning glory, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that open in the evening and close by morning, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbing plants. Its flowers are typically pale purple to white, with a distinctive, spurred corolla. Nycteranthus inaequalis is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments.
